channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: TikTok calls her ‘32 pizzas mom.’ What her videos can teach us about how we spend money.
item.description: A $500 grocery-haul video has gone viral for sparking a conversation about when stocking up on groceries might go too far

item.title: Powell just gambled big in Jackson Hole. Will it pay off?
item.description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell on Friday opened the door to an interest-rate cut, surprising many economists.

item.description: Agility Robotics, Amazon, Boston Dynamics, Figure and other leading robotics companies already using NVIDIA Jetson Thor. The post NVIDIA Jetson Thor b...

item.title: Why do so many investors think the stock market is forming a bubble?
item.description: A big increase in predictions that a bubble is about to burst actually makes it less likely that one will, contrarians say

item.title: Physical AI takes center stage at RoboBusiness

item.title: Primech launches upgraded bathroom cleaning robot

item.title: Stock market braces for Nvidia earnings as S&P 500 struggles to extend Jackson Hole rally
item.description: The U.S. stock market faces a Big Tech test this week.

item.title: ‘The money went into his account’: Is my father trying to swindle me out of my grandparents’ $800K home?
item.description: “I came across a letter from my father’s bank showing a wire transfer of $195,000 from the buyer.”

item.title: How lidar measures the cost of climate disasters

item.title: Developers lose focus 1,200 times a day — how MCP could change that
item.description: One of the most impactful applications of MCP is its ability to connect AI coding assistants directly to developer tools.

item.title: Busted by the em dash — AI’s favorite punctuation mark, and how it’s blowing your cover
item.description: AI is brilliant at polishing and rephrasing. But like a child with glitter glue, you still need to supervise it.

item.title: How automation and farm robots are transforming agriculture

item.title: OpenCUA’s open source computer-use agents rival proprietary models from OpenAI and Anthropic
item.description: The open source framework provides the data and training recipe for building powerful computer-use agents that challenge proprietary systems.

item.title: MCP-Universe benchmark shows GPT-5 fails more than half of real-world orchestration tasks
item.description: A new benchmark from Salesforce research evaluates model and agentic performance on real-life enterprise tasks.

item.title: Meta is partnering with Midjourney and will license its technology for ‘future models and products’
item.description: Details are scarce on how much if any money is involved. And what does it mean for Midjourney's previously announced plans for an enterprise API?
